Subject: PUT/POST content type hints
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=9541458; y=RBJ768d6D_SaHbLxRzh5dFHovT1ryD4mT8-K4W2k9A

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

I'm sure this has been covered in the past, but I missed it... what are some
general guidelines for giving a client hints about what sort of data to
supply to a resource which responds to POST or PUT?  I'm interested both in
hints about general content-type and encoding, as well more specific hints
such as a RelaxNG schema for a resource which expects XML, or an expected
 JSON Schema.

For that matter, are there any good ways to give hints about the fields that
are expected in application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data?

It seems like there could be some tricky cases here for resources which can
accept multiple content types.

Interested in any advice you folks might have.

Thanks,

-- 
Avdi
